titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Students Organizing Students Records TAM.266
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicole Greenhouse

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-04-30T11:38-0400

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.physloc: Materials stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@library.nyu.edu at least two business days prior to research visit.
did.abstract: This collection contains the records of Students Organizing Students, a women's health and reproductive rights organization, active from 1989-1995. The collection contains their office working files and materials from their programs and campaigns.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Tamiment holds the records of a few additional reproductive rights organizations:

National Organization for Women, New York City Chapter (NOW-NYC) Records (TAM 106)
WHAM! (Women's Health Action and Mobilization) Records (TAM 162)

Tamiment also holds some reproductive rights personal papers:
Karen Stamm: Women's Reproductive and Health Rights Papers (TAM 212)
Leslie Cagan Papers (TAM 138)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection documents the activities of Students Organizing Students concerning women’s reproductive health issues. Materials include brochures, ephemera, newsletters, photographs, correspondence, t-shirts, field reports, ten VHS tapes, cassette audio tapes, organizer manuals, meeting minutes, and administrative files. Documents concerning budgeting, grant proposals, staff and board of director meeting minutes demonstrate the organization’s administrative functions. Other materials document the organization’s commitment to community outreach, including materials concerning specific events and the organization’s internship and training programs (such as SKILLS [Students Keeping Issues Linked – Leadership Semester] and AWARE [Asian Women’s Access to Resources and Education]).

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Students Organizing Students (SOS) was formed in 1989, in response to Supreme Court's decision in the ruling of Webster v. Reproductive Health Services. Throughout their existence, the organization worked to educate and mobilize young people for reproductive freedom. SOS, along with the National Organization for Women (NOW) and WHAM! (Women's Health Action Mobilization), organized a boycott of Domino's Pizza (Domino's CEO, Tom Monaghan, was a major contributor to right-to-life-organizations) and led to Monaghan's resignation. The organization also held the yearly National Student Conference on Reproductive Rights, a field organizer program, and a training task force on reproductive rights. SOS reorganized in 1992, and broadened their agenda to not only reproductive rights, but to women's health. This included AIDS/HIV awareness programs, date rape, domestic and access to health services to underprivileged groups. The organization was active until 1995 when their material was donated to Tamiment Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Photographs were separated from this collection during initial processing and were established as a separate collection, the Students Organizing Students Photographs (PHOTOS 137). In 2013, the photograph collection was reincorporated into the Students Organizing Students Records.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Copyright holder is unknown. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:

70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Students Organizing Students Records; TAM 266; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
